abstract: The net neutrality debate is not over whether there will be first class and coach seats, but how those seats will be priced and who will pay for them.
snippet: The net neutrality debate is not over whether there will be first class and coach seats, but how those seats will be priced and who will pay for them.
lead_paragraph: Let’s not lose sight of this: There really is a war going on between the phone companies and Google over the way Internet traffic will be priced. And both sides want their self interest to appear to be morally superior.

headline.main: Google’s ‘Treat All Rich Companies the Same’ Vision of Net Neutrality
